					<span>Geyora Giladi</span>,

						February 2014

					<section class="hotel-reviews_section item ">
				<header><div>100%</div><h1>I would love to return</h1></header>

				<p>It was a very nice, relaxing hotel. I read reviews where people were complaining about the airport noise and unless you had your window open you couldn’t hear the planes. I couldn’t hear any noise from adjoining rooms or the hallway. The room was very clean and spacious. The breakfast was excellent. I got a massage from the spa and it was very relaxing. I did book it a week in advance to be safe. The staff at the front desk, restaurant and spa all spoke some English and were very helpful. It has a nice gym and pool. Overall I really liked the hotel and would recommend it to anyway. I went for a girls spa weekend, but am considering going back with my husband for a relaxing weekend getaway.  My only complaint of the hotel is that there really isn’t anything to do within walking distance, but they do offer a shuttle service if you want to go into Verona.</p>

				<cite>
					<span>Mandi Overby</span>,

					<span>
						January 2014
					</span>
				<cite>

</section>			<section
		id="description"
		class="content-feeder"
		data-dojo-type="escapio/components/base/ContentFeeder"
		data-dojo-props="step:0"
		itemprop="description"
		data-dojo-mixins="escapio/components/event-tracker/ContentFeederTrackerMixin"
		data-box="Beschreibung"
	>
		<header><h1>Hotel description</h1></header>
					<section class="item ">
								<div>All rooms are individually decorated and have spacious bathrooms with marble sinks, designer pieces, accents. The sunny wellness area offers an indoor salt water pool, a warm outdoor jacuzzi and in-house library to ensure cultured relaxation. In the bar "Corte 22" you can enjoy cocktails in a refined atmosphere, while in the La Tavola" restaurant visitors can try typical Veronese dishes with an innovative touch.</div>
			</section>
					<section class="item ">
									<header>4-star Hotel: Modern comfort in a historic monastery</header>
								<div>Hotel Veronesi la Torre is located in a 500 year-old former monastery located near Verona. It is surrounded by an idyllic garden and a fountain bubbles soothingly in the courtyard. Thanks to the extensive restoration carried out in 2008, the charming flair of the old building has been preserved and combined with contemporary design. 86 rooms and suites and two apartments offer classic elegance with marble details and modern comfort - all the rooms include wifi and Sky TV. The rooms are bright and furnished with natural stone walls and nut wood parquet. Seven spacious suites (30-50 m²) are offered in addition to traditional hotel rooms. The romantic tower suite is located in the medieval tower. It is decorated with furniture by famous designers and features a bathroom in Lessinia stone with bathtub, shower and sink in red Verona marble.</div>
			</section>
					<section class="item hidden-xs">
									<header>Wellness: Bright spa with swimming pool, sauna, steam and aroma bath</header>
								<div>The 800 m² large spa area of the hotel offers an indoor salt water pool with 30° C warm water, a Jacuzzi corner and outdoor heated Jacuzzi, also with salt water. One can sweat out impurities in the Finnish sauna or in the aromatic steam bath; afterwards, the aroma shower and ice fountain provide the chance to cool off. A good library in the Atrium transforms the bright room into a quiet oasis of cultivated relaxation, which is rounded out with a well-stocked tea bar. In the beauty centre, customized beauty treatments for face and body are offered to cater to the individual needs of the guests as well as hand and nail care. Massages and lymphatic drainage provide perfect relaxation.</div>
			</section>
					<section class="item hidden-xs">
									<header>Design: stone walls, light wood floors, contemporary furniture and individual design</header>
								<div>The 86 rooms and suites within the walls of the monastery are equipped with designer furniture by important Italian designers such as Carlo Scarpa, Achille and Piergiacomo Castiglioni as well as top international designers such as Charles and Ray Eames or Man Ray. Each room is unique: each door is clad with an individual marble slab. Natural stone walls, nut wood floors and large windows ensure that each room has a welcoming atmosphere. Two luxurious apartments with two rooms each are fitted with marble floors and stylish designer furniture. They feature a dishwasher, refrigerator, microwave oven and washing machine.</div>
			</section>
					<section class="item hidden-xs">
									<header>Food & drink: Breakfast, innovative Veronese cuisine, cocktail bar with reading corner</header>
								<div>The breakfast at the hotel Veronesi la Torre leaves nothing to be desired: cereals, ham and cheese, fresh eggs, and delicious fruit are served in a buffet each morning. Breakfast can be eaten on the terrace in the warmer months. Our restaurant "La Tavola" features several rooms with very different atmospheres which can accommodate both a romantic candle-light dinner and a cozy dinner with friends. The restaurant serves typical Veronese cuisine, which is traditional and innovative at the same time, using local produce from the region of Verona. Appetizers, delicious cocktails and coffee are served in the bar "Corte 22". The elegant and exquisite bar has a reading area where you can relax after a busy day.</div>
			</section>
					<section class="item hidden-xs">
									<header>Sport & leisure time: Modern fitness room, salt water swimming pool, Pilates and yoga</header>
								<div>The hotel’s offerings include a bright, spacious spa area with sauna, steam bath, aroma shower and ice fountain. Massages and beauty treatments ensure relaxation. The fitness area is 110 m². It is equipped with both cardio and cardio-vascular equipment. One room is entirely dedicated to Pilates and contains mats and corresponding equipment. A qualified Pilates trainer teaches classes here. On request, a personal trainer can create a personalized fitness program. In the swimming pool, one can do laps or participate in an aqua-fitness course. Those who like a more relaxed fitness approach can take advantage of the complete yoga programme.</div>
			</section>
					<section class="item hidden-xs">
									<header>Location: in front of the gates of Verona</header>
								<div>Hotel Veronesi la Torre is located in the immediate vicinity of the Valerio Catullo Verona Airport in the town of Dossobuono di Villafranca. Only 12 km away from Verona, visitors can be in the city centre in just 20 minutes. By foot you can enjoy the best of the historic center of Verona, which is protected as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. A free shuttle service is also available from the hotel. 35 kilometres away lies Italy’s largest lake, Lake Garda, on the edge of the Alps.</div>
			</section>
					<section class="item hidden-xs">
									<header>What else? A modern conference centre</header>
								<div>Hotel Veronesi la Torre-has its own Conference Center, with 11 sunny conference rooms that are equipped with the latest technology. Three of the rooms can be equipped with a stage or a catwalk when needed. The proximity to Verona Airport and the hotel’s own heliport make the hotel ideal for business meetings, conferences, workshops and meetings.</div>
			</section>
			</section>

content: pool, spa area, restaurant Hotel Type: Spa, 4 star, Design, Historic, Apartment Hotel size (number of rooms): 90 Check-in: 14:00 | Check-out: 11:00 Great place for a week end.Good comfortable rooms and excellent spa. Convenient 15 minutes drive from Verona’s center. Reasonable priced. Geyora Giladi , February 2014 It was a very nice, relaxing hotel. I read reviews where people were complaining about the airport noise and unless you had your window open you couldn’t hear the planes. I couldn’t hear any noise from adjoining rooms or the hallway. The room was very clean and spacious. The breakfast was excellent. I got a massage from the spa and it was very relaxing. I did book it a week in advance to be safe. The staff at the front desk, restaurant and spa all spoke some English and were very helpful. It has a nice gym and pool. Overall I really liked the hotel and would recommend it to anyway. I went for a girls spa weekend, but am considering going back with my husband for a relaxing weekend getaway. My only complaint of the hotel is that there really isn’t anything to do within walking distance, but they do offer a shuttle service if you want to go into Verona. Mandi Overby , January 2014 29 Hotel in restored historic monastery with individually furnished rooms Car is secure in a roofed parking lot Free shuttle bus to the Valerio Catullo airport and in the city centre of Verona Friendly staff Entrance tickets for the Opera or any other concerts and events as well as check-in for flights directly available at the hotel Due to the proximity to the airport, not recommended for very noise-sensitive people Due to its location in a small village without many restaurants, a car is beneficial wheelchair access elevator wireless LAN internet cable in rooms free air conditioning in all rooms non-smoking building entire hotel incl. lobby parking garage / covered parking terrace breakfast served on terrace, sunbeds laundry service garden / outside area tanning bed extra charge bar restaurant restaurant La Tavola reception 24 hour reception airport shuttle free tour and excursion bookings events service weddings room service sewing / ironing service heliport / helipad packages safe free late Check out Via Monte Baldo 22 - Dossobuono di Villafranca 37062 Verona Veneto, Italy Map noisy when windows open audible air traffic weddings and events at hotel noise just during daytime motorway 5 km (A22 - Verona Nord) train station 8 km (Verona Porta Nuova) airport 0,8 km (Villafranca VRN) public transport stop 0,8 km (Airport shuttle bus) trade fair center 7 km (Verona Fiere) nearest city 7 km (Verona) golf course 5 km (Golf Club Verona) historic district 1 km tourist sights 4,7 km (Nicolis Museum) city center 8 km (Verona centre) beach 20 km (Lazise) All rooms are individually decorated and have spacious bathrooms with marble sinks, designer pieces, accents. The sunny wellness area offers an indoor salt water pool, a warm outdoor jacuzzi and in-house library to ensure cultured relaxation. In the bar "Corte 22" you can enjoy cocktails in a refined atmosphere, while in the La Tavola" restaurant visitors can try typical Veronese dishes with an innovative touch. Hotel Veronesi la Torre is located in a 500 year-old former monastery located near Verona. It is surrounded by an idyllic garden and a fountain bubbles soothingly in the courtyard. Thanks to the extensive restoration carried out in 2008, the charming flair of the old building has been preserved and combined with contemporary design. 86 rooms and suites and two apartments offer classic elegance with marble details and modern comfort - all the rooms include wifi and Sky TV. The rooms are bright and furnished with natural stone walls and nut wood parquet. Seven spacious suites (30-50 m²) are offered in addition to traditional hotel rooms. The romantic tower suite is located in the medieval tower. It is decorated with furniture by famous designers and features a bathroom in Lessinia stone with bathtub, shower and sink in red Verona marble. The 800 m² large spa area of the hotel offers an indoor salt water pool with 30° C warm water, a Jacuzzi corner and outdoor heated Jacuzzi, also with salt water. One can sweat out impurities in the Finnish sauna or in the aromatic steam bath; afterwards, the aroma shower and ice fountain provide the chance to cool off. A good library in the Atrium transforms the bright room into a quiet oasis of cultivated relaxation, which is rounded out with a well-stocked tea bar. In the beauty centre, customized beauty treatments for face and body are offered to cater to the individual needs of the guests as well as hand and nail care. Massages and lymphatic drainage provide perfect relaxation. The 86 rooms and suites within the walls of the monastery are equipped with designer furniture by important Italian designers such as Carlo Scarpa, Achille and Piergiacomo Castiglioni as well as top international designers such as Charles and Ray Eames or Man Ray. Each room is unique: each door is clad with an individual marble slab. Natural stone walls, nut wood floors and large windows ensure that each room has a welcoming atmosphere. Two luxurious apartments with two rooms each are fitted with marble floors and stylish designer furniture. They feature a dishwasher, refrigerator, microwave oven and washing machine. The breakfast at the hotel Veronesi la Torre leaves nothing to be desired: cereals, ham and cheese, fresh eggs, and delicious fruit are served in a buffet each morning. Breakfast can be eaten on the terrace in the warmer months. Our restaurant "La Tavola" features several rooms with very different atmospheres which can accommodate both a romantic candle-light dinner and a cozy dinner with friends. The restaurant serves typical Veronese cuisine, which is traditional and innovative at the same time, using local produce from the region of Verona. Appetizers, delicious cocktails and coffee are served in the bar "Corte 22". The elegant and exquisite bar has a reading area where you can relax after a busy day. The hotel’s offerings include a bright, spacious spa area with sauna, steam bath, aroma shower and ice fountain. Massages and beauty treatments ensure relaxation. The fitness area is 110 m². It is equipped with both cardio and cardio-vascular equipment. One room is entirely dedicated to Pilates and contains mats and corresponding equipment. A qualified Pilates trainer teaches classes here. On request, a personal trainer can create a personalized fitness program. In the swimming pool, one can do laps or participate in an aqua-fitness course. Those who like a more relaxed fitness approach can take advantage of the complete yoga programme. Hotel Veronesi la Torre is located in the immediate vicinity of the Valerio Catullo Verona Airport in the town of Dossobuono di Villafranca. Only 12 km away from Verona, visitors can be in the city centre in just 20 minutes. By foot you can enjoy the best of the historic center of Verona, which is protected as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. A free shuttle service is also available from the hotel. 35 kilometres away lies Italy’s largest lake, Lake Garda, on the edge of the Alps. Hotel Veronesi la Torre-has its own Conference Center, with 11 sunny conference rooms that are equipped with the latest technology. Three of the rooms can be equipped with a stage or a catwalk when needed. The proximity to Verona Airport and the hotel’s own heliport make the hotel ideal for business meetings, conferences, workshops and meetings.
